definition: to drown/to indulge/addicted to/to spoil (a child)

sentences.english: He wonders whether she has drowned.
sentences.chinese: 他想知道她是否已經溺死了。

sentences.english: A drowning man will clutch at a straw.
sentences.chinese: 快溺死的人連一根稻草也要抓。

sentences.english: Tom beat about in the sea,trying not to drown.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆在海里亂撲騰，設法不被溺死。

sentences.english: He decided to drown the animal.
Is lonely drowned love into tears in india.
sentences.chinese: 被寂寞溺死的愛情，成了淚海中的浮屍。

sentences.english: Chances are that the people who go overboard will die- from drowning, shark attack, or the cold.
sentences.chinese: 跳下去的人能夠溺死，被鯊魚襲擊或許凍死。

sentences.english: Lycidas was drowned. His remains are unrecoverable.
sentences.chinese: 利西達斯溺死於大海，他的遺骸已經找不到了。

sentences.english: I someone had been with him, he might not have been drowned.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人在他旁邊，或許他就不會溺死。

sentences.english: Background Drowning is defined as death due to submersion in liquid.
sentences.chinese: 溺死是指淹沒於液體之中發生的死亡。

sentences.english: This can cause convulsions and loss of consciousness underwater with drowning.
sentences.chinese: 這會引起抽搐和意識喪失在水下溺死。

sentences.english: This means that a bath could cause your child to drown.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着即使是洗個澡也可能溺死你的孩子。

sentences.english: Without a moments hesitation, she jumped into the river to save the drowning girl.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不猶豫地跳進河裏去救快要溺死的女孩。

sentences.english: Dry drowning can occur up to 24 hours after even a small amount of water invades the lungs.
sentences.chinese: 幹型溺死會在吸入少量水後24小時內發生。

definition: lit. to be buried in the bellies of fish (idiom)/fig. to drown
to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
to bury a corpse/to be buried/(fig.) to die (at sea, in a fire etc)
to drown/to indulge/addicted to/to spoil (a child)
to flood/to submerge/to drown/to irritate the skin (of liquids)/to delay
